constantValues: A Codeable Concept represents a value that is usually supplied by providing a reference to one or more terminologies, but may also be defined by the provision of text.

foreignKeyAttribute.name: createdBy

constantValues: Unique identifier of the user who created the record.

members.name: code

constantValues: Code defined by a terminology system.

constantValues: The name of the custom entity.

members.name: text

constantValues: Plain text representation of the concept.

Type of: Code-ableConcept represents a value that is usually supplied by providing a reference to one or more terminologies or ontologies, but may also be defined by the provision of text.

definitions.description: A Codeable Concept represents a value that is usually supplied by providing a reference to one or more terminologies, but may also be defined by the provision of text.
